channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Anti social behaviour and drug use, 26th August
item.description:
The upper property of number 32 has constant visitors all day and night causing noise, people standing on the street in a state of drug use. The smell of drugs is always in the air at all times of the day. Some of the visitors intimidate and harass people.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags opposite Madame Tussauds at allsop place next to bin, 26th August
item.description:
Bags causing nuisance and hazard on pavement of allsop place next to litter bin opposite Madame Tussauds need to clear out.

item.title: Bramble overgrown street cleaning, 26th August
item.description:
Along Bexley road SE9 towards Eltham on the (school side) the pavement in places has been over taken by brambles, I have reported this before. also a build up of leaves along this path hasn't been cleared in months. I am a local resident and use this path regularly so I know this hasn't been done. Please will you give this your up most attention. Many thanks Jackie Edwards
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ingledew Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light 254917A STILL not working, 26th August
item.description:
This problem has been reported several times before: street light outside 48 Alleyn Park is STILL not working and has been off since 8 July. It keeps happening (as stated, reported several times before). Please can Southwark get it properly fixed? THANK YOU
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48 - 58 Alleyn Park, Dulwich, London

item.title: Multiple estate agents' advertising boards attached to street sign., 26th August
item.description:
Please remove these agents boards which are unsightly and are not located within the boundaries of the properties in question. Furthermore, they are left indefinitely; these have been around for months. This is a reoccurring issue, so the agents concerned should be reminded of the restrictions on where their boards may be placed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 151, Shooters Hill, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-8, Polygon Road, Somers Town, London

item.title: General rubbish, 26th August
item.description:
The whole of Abbey Wood road is an eyesore. The pavements and gutters are covered in general rubbish - plastic bottles, cans, takeaway containers, food waste, broken glass bottles (already reported over a week ago) etc. It is unpleasant to walk amongst and unsafe. Constantly dodging rubbish and having to pull dogs away from broken glass and dumped food.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Wood Road, Abbey Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Closed footway - Fenchurch Street, 26th August
item.description:
22/08/2025 10:50 Comments: This footpath closure has the potential to be extremely dangerous and could cause an accident. During the day, footpath capacity is greatly reduced with pedestrians forced to use the other side of the road, causing overcrowding. At night time, this is more dangerous because pedestrians are ignoring the signage and walking in the road next to the closed path into oncoming traffic. In the dark, this has the potential to result in a serious accident. Especially when some people may be under the influence of alcohol. It will result in a vehicle collision where vehicles swerve to avoid pedestrians in the road or a pedestrian will be hit in the road. It would seem to be more sensible to close part of the road and make it single lane traffic, controlled by traffic lights if need be, and use the closed section of road as a footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Star Alley, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 26th August
item.description:

item.title: Graffiti, 26th August
item.description:
